sentences.literal: Kong Zi was born in Zou yi of Chang Ping xiang in Lu.
His ancestors were Song people, called Kong Fang Shu.

sentences.chinese: 防叔生伯夏，伯夏生叔梁紇。
sentences.literal: Fang Shu gave birth to Bo Xia. Bo Xia gave birth to Shu Liang He.

sentences.chinese: 紇與顏氏女野合而生孔子，禱於尼丘得孔子。
sentences.literal: He had a wild union with a Yan clan woman and gave birth to Kong Zi. They prayed at Ni Qiu and got Kong Zi.

sentences.chinese: 魯襄公二十二年而孔子生。
sentences.literal: Kong Zi was born in the twenty-second year of Lu Xiang Gong.

sentences.chinese: 生而首上圩頂，故因名曰丘云。
sentences.literal: He was born with a sunken top to his head, thus he was named Qiu because of this.
He was styled Zhong Ni and was of the Kong clan.

sentences.chinese: 丘生而叔梁紇死，葬於防山。
sentences.literal: Qiu was born and Shu Liang He died, buried at Fang Shan.

sentences.chinese: 防山在魯東，由是孔子疑其父墓處，母諱之也。
sentences.literal: Fang Shan is east of Lu. Thus Kong Zi doubted where his father's grave was - his mother avoided speaking of it.

sentences.chinese: 孔子為兒嬉戲，常陳俎豆，設禮容。
sentences.literal: When Kong Zi was a child playing, he often arranged the ritual vessels and set the ceremonial appearance.

sentences.chinese: 孔子母死，乃殯五父之衢，蓋其慎也。
sentences.literal: Kong Zi's mother died, and thus he encoffined her at the Wu Fu crossroads - probably due to his carefulness.

sentences.chinese: 郰人輓父之母誨孔子父墓，然後往合葬於防焉。
sentences.literal: A Zhu person, the mother of Wan Fu, taught Kong Zi about his father's grave, then he went to jointly bury them at Fang.

sentences.chinese: 孔子要絰，季氏饗士，孔子與往。
sentences.literal: Kong Zi was in mourning. The Ji clan feasted scholars, and Kong Zi went along.

sentences.chinese: 其祖弗父何始有宋而嗣讓厲公。
sentences.literal: His ancestor Fu Fu He began having Song and the heir yielded to Li Gong.
